concise_definition: v. 失去, 输掉, 丢失; adj. 失败的, 丧失的

definitions.explanation_en: To fail to win in a game, competition, or contest; to be defeated by an opponent.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在游戏、比赛或竞争中未能获胜，被对手击败。
definitions.example_en: They were losing the match by three goals with only five minutes left.
definitions.example_cn: 比赛还剩五分钟时，他们以三球落后。

definitions.explanation_en: To no longer have or possess something, often unintentionally or through misplacement, death, or separation.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指不再拥有或持有某物，通常是非故意的，如遗失、死亡或分离所致。
definitions.example_en: She is losing her keys again—this is the third time this week.
definitions.example_cn: 她又丢钥匙了——这周第三次了。

definitions.explanation_en: To gradually diminish or decline in quality, quantity, or strength over time.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指随着时间推移，质量、数量或力量逐渐减弱或衰退。
definitions.example_en: The company is losing market share to its competitors.
definitions.example_cn: 该公司正在失去市场份额，输给竞争对手。

definitions.explanation_en: Describing a person or team that is currently defeated or at a disadvantage in a contest or situation.
definitions.explanation_cn: 形容在比赛或情境中当前处于失败或劣势地位的人或团队。
definitions.example_en: The losing candidate gave a gracious speech after the election.
definitions.example_cn: 落选的候选人选举后发表了得体的演讲。

comparison.analysis: “Defeated” (被击败的) 是一个形容词或过去分词，强调结果——已经输掉比赛或战斗，具有确定性和完成性。而 “losing” 是现在分词或形容词，强调正在进行中的劣势状态，尚未最终定局。例如：He is losing the fight（他正在输），但 He was defeated（他已被击败）。
“Misplacing” (放错地方) 专指因疏忽而把物品放在错误的位置，是“losing” 的一种具体原因，但范围更窄。而 “losing” 可涵盖遗失、失去、输掉、丧失等多种含义，包括抽象概念（如失去信心）和不可逆的结果（如失去亲人）。
“Declining” (衰退) 通常用于描述趋势性的、渐进的下降，如经济、健康或人口，常带中性或客观色彩。而 “losing” 更强调主动的、可能由外部竞争或意外导致的损失，带有更强的情感色彩（如遗憾、挫败）。例如：The population is declining（人口在减少） vs. We are losing customers（我们在失去客户）。
